titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn historic houses slide collection V1974.038
titlestmt.author: Weatherly Stephan
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-09-21 15:36:17 +0000.

did.abstract: The slides contain photographs and illustrations of notable historic Dutch homes located throughout Brooklyn, most of which are identified by family name.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright will remain in effect for 120 years following the date of creation. Based on the date range of this collection, all items will enter the public domain between 2030 and 2080. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Item-level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Brooklyn historic houses slide collection dates from circa 1910 to 1960 and contains 15 slides in plastic and metal mounts. The slides contain photographs and illustrations of notable historic Dutch homes located throughout Brooklyn, most of which are identified by family name.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Fully processed to the item level.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn historic houses slide collection, V1974.038, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition for the collection are unknown. This collection was accessioned in 1974.
